decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).

The proposed development hereby approved shall be constructed in accordance with the materials detailed under Section denoted 'materials' of the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To ensure that the appearance of the proposed development will harmonise with the character of the surrounding area.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) the storage building and refuse store hereby approved shall be used solely by the occupiers of the  dwelling houses at No's 19b and 19c Suttons Lane.  They shall only be used for their stated purposes of storage, including refuse and cycle storage,  and not for any other purpose including use for any trade or business nor as living accommodation.  They shall not be used for any purpose connected with the commercial building at the front of the site, currently known as 19 Suttons Lane.
To restrict the use to one compatible with a residential area.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, no window or other opening (other than those shown on the submitted and approved plan,) shall be formed in the flank wall(s) of the building(s) hereby permitted, unless specific permission under the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 has first been sought and obtained in writing from the Local Planning Authority.
In order to ensure a satisfactory development that will not result in any loss of privacy or damage to the environment of neighbouring properties which exist or may be proposed in the future.

The roof area of the storage building hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the Local Planning Authority.
In the interests of the amenity of the occupiers of neighbouring dwelling.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with the agent via email. The revisions involved reducing the internal footprint of the storage building. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 15/04/2024.
description: Erection of a single storey storage and cycle building and covered bin storage area ancillary to the flats at 19 Suttons Lane, Hornchurch.
